Provision.Text: His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Fisheries and Oceans, pursuant to subsections 34(2), 36(5) and 43(1)a and (2)b of the Fisheries Actc, makes the annexed Aquatic Invasive Species Regulations.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: aquatic invasive species means a species set out in Part 2 or 3 of the schedule. (espèce aquatique envahissante)
indigenous, in respect of an aquatic species, means that the species originated naturally in a particular region or body of water. (indigène)

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 43(3) of the Act, the list of aquatic invasive species is the list set out in Parts 2 and 3 of the schedule.
Before publishing proposed regulations made under subsection 43(3) of the Act, the Minister must provide the President of the Treasury Board with an estimate of the costs of their implementation.

A reference in these Regulations to an aquatic invasive species or family of aquatic invasive species by its common name as set out in column 1 in Part 2 or 3 of the schedule is to be read as a reference to the scientific name of that species or family of species that is set out in column 2.
In the event of an inconsistency between these Regulations and any other regulations made under the Act, these Regulations prevail to the extent of the inconsistency.

It is prohibited for any person to import members of a species set out in Part 2 of the schedule, including any genetic material capable of propagating the species, into the applicable area set out in column 4 of that Part, unless the member is in the condition, if any, set out in column 3.

It is prohibited for any person to possess members of a species set out in Part 2 of the schedule, including any genetic material capable of propagating the species, within the applicable area set out in column 5 of that Part, unless the member is in the condition, if any, set out in column 3.

It is prohibited for any person to transport members of a species set out in Part 2 of the schedule, including any genetic material capable of propagating the species, within the applicable area set out in column 6 of that Part, unless the member is in the condition, if any, set out in column 3.

It is prohibited for any person to release, or engage in any activity that may lead to the release of, members of a species set out in Part 2 of the schedule, including any genetic material capable of propagating the species, into a body of water frequented by fish within the applicable area set out in column 7 of that Part, unless the member is in the condition, if any, set out in column 3.

Section.MarginalNote: Prohibition against introduction of non-indigenous species
Section.Text: It is prohibited for any person to introduce an aquatic species into a particular region or body of water frequented by fish where it is not indigenous unless authorized to do so under federal or provincial law.
Sections 6 to 9 do not apply to fishery officers or fishery guardians carrying out their duties under these Regulations or to any other person acting under their direction.
Sections 6 to 10 do not apply to persons operating any vehicles, vessels or aircraft engaged in emergency, search and rescue or firefighting operations.

Subsection.Text: If the purpose of the importation, possession, transportation or release of members of a species set out in Part 2 of the schedule is for scientific, educational or aquatic invasive species control purposes, sections 6 to 9 do not apply

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to employees or any other person acting under the direction of

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a federal or provincial department with a mandate to manage or control aquatic invasive species; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to persons engaged in the activities authorized under subsection 19(3).

Subsection.Text: The employees or persons exempted under subparagraphs (1)(a)(i) to (iii) must hold the applicable permits, licences and authorizations issued under the following provisions:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: section 6.1 of the Manitoba Fishery Regulations, 1987;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: section 19 of the Quebec Fishery Regulations, 1990;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: sections 52 and 56 of the Fishery (General) Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 9(3) of the Saskatchewan Fishery Regulations, 1995;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 6(2) of the Ontario Fishery Regulations, 2007;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: sections 34.1 and 34.2 of Fish Licensing of Ontario, O. Reg. 664/98;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 3(1) of the Fishing Licensing Regulation of Manitoba, Man. Reg. 124/97;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: section 3 of the Freshwater Fish Regulation of British Columbia, B.C. Reg. 261/83;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 88(3) and section 88.1 of The Fisheries Regulations of Saskatchewan, R.R.S. c. F-16.1 Reg. 1;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 12(1) of the Fisheries (Alberta) Act of Alberta, R.S.A. 2000, c. F-16;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: section 86 of the Wild Life Regulations of Newfoundland and Labrador, C.N.L.R. 1156/96;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: all applicable provisions in regulations made under the Canada National Parks Act.

Section.Text: Section 7 does not apply to a person holding a fishing licence who has caught a member of a species set out in Part 2 of the schedule if that person takes immediate measures to destroy the member in a manner that ensures that it and any genetic material capable of propagating the species cannot survive.

Subsection.Text: Section 7 does not apply, in respect of the possession of diploid grass carp, to persons employed by the Aquaculture Centre of Excellence at Lethbridge College and Alberta Agriculture and Rural Development, or persons under their direction, if they hold a fish research licence issued under subsection 12(1) of the Fisheries (Alberta) Act of Alberta and if the diploid grass carp are possessed for the purpose of culturing triploid grass carp.

Sections 7 and 8 do not apply, in respect of the possession and transportation of triploid grass carp, to persons holding a cultured fish licence issued under subsection 12(1) of the Fisheries (Alberta) Act of Alberta.

Section.MarginalNote: Exemption for holder of cultured fish licence
Section.Text: Section 9 does not apply to persons holding a cultured fish licence issued under subsection 12(1) of the Fisheries (Alberta) Act of Alberta in respect of the release of grass carp — that have been confirmed as triploid grass carp — for the purpose of vegetation control, in a body of water on privately owned land that is isolated from other bodies of water in a manner that ensures that the grass carp will not adversely affect — in any other body of water — other fish, fish habitat or the use of fish.

Subsection.Text: Sections 6 to 10 and directions given under subsections 22(2), 26(1) and 27(1), do not apply

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of ballast water and sediments that are carried on board a vessel designed or constructed to carry ballast water, to the persons referred to in subsection 4(1) of the Ballast Water Regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the biofouling of a vessel that is over 24 m in length, to the person in charge of the vessel.

Subsection.Text: A fishery officer or fishery guardian must not take the measures referred to in subsection 25(1) in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ballast water and sediments that are carried on board a vessel designed or constructed to carry ballast water; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the biofouling of a vessel that is over 24 m in length.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsections (1) and (2), biofouling means the accumulation of aquatic organisms such as micro-organisms, plants and animals on surfaces and structures that are immersed in or exposed to the aquatic environment.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Definitions of ballast water and sediments
Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsections (1) and (2), ballast water and sediments have the same meaning as in subsection 1(1) of the Ballast Water Regulations.

Section.Text: The following persons are prescribed under paragraph 36(5)(f) of the Act:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister of Fisheries and Oceans;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister responsible for the Parks Canada Agency;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for Ontario, the provincial Minister of Natural Resources and Forestry;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for Nova Scotia, the provincial Minister of Fisheries and Aquaculture;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: for Manitoba, the provincial Minister of Conservation and Water Stewardship;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: for British Columbia, the provincial Minister of Environment and the provincial Minister of Forests, Lands and Natural Resource Operations;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: for Saskatchewan, the provincial Minister of Environment;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: for Alberta, the provincial Minister of Environment and Sustainable Resource Development; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: for Yukon, the territorial Minister of Environment.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of this section and sections 27 and 28, Minister means any of the persons listed in section 18.
The Minister may take a measure referred to in subsection (3)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to prevent the introduction or spread of, or to control or eradicate,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any species set out in Part 2 of the schedule in the areas in which it is prohibited,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any species set out in Part 2 or 3 of the schedule in a particular region or body of water frequented by fish where the species is not indigenous and may harm fish, fish habitat or the use of fish, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: any aquatic species, other than a species set out in Part 2 or 3 of the schedule, in a particular region or body of water frequented by fish where the aquatic species is not indigenous and may harm fish, fish habitat or the use of fish; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to treat or destroy any member of a species described in paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: Despite any other regulations made under the Act, the Minister may authorize the deposit of deleterious substances belonging to one of the classes of deleterious substances authorized under section 21 and provide directions for their deposit in any water or place referred to in subsection 36(3) of the Act.
Subsection (3) does not apply in respect of aquaculture activities if the deposit of a deleterious substance is otherwise authorized under the Act.

Section.MarginalNote: Licensed fishing for aquatic invasive species
Section.Text: Despite any other regulations made under the Act, the Minister and any provincial minister having jurisdiction over fisheries may license fishing for any species referred to in subsection 19(2) in the places referred to in that subsection.
The following classes of deleterious substances are authorized for the purpose of paragraph 36(4)(b) of the Act and subsections 19(3) and 27(1):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: drugs whose sale is permitted or otherwise authorized, or whose importation is not prohibited, under the Food and Drugs Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: pest control products that are registered, or whose use is authorized, under the Pest Control Products Act.

Subsection.Text: A fishery officer or fishery guardian may notify a person, directly or through a public notice, that an aquatic species is not indigenous in a particular region or body of water frequented by fish.

In the event that the unauthorized introduction of an aquatic species into a particular region or body of water frequented by fish where it is not indigenous is imminent or in the process of occurring, a fishery officer may give a direction to a person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prohibiting that person from engaging in any activity that may lead to that introduction; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: directing that person to cease engaging in any activity that may lead to that introduction.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in sections 25 to 27 and 29.

Definition.Text: carrier means anything, other than a conveyance or structure, that is a host to, or that facilitates the movement of, a species set out in Part 2 or 3 of the schedule. (porteur)
conveyance or structure means a conveyance or structure that is a host to, or that facilitates the movement of, a species set out in Part 2 or 3 of the schedule. (moyen de transport ou structure)

Section.Text: A fishery officer or fishery guardian may take a measure set out in section 25 or give a direction set out in section 26 only

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to determine whether the species is an aquatic invasive species;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to prevent the introduction or spread of, or to control or eradicate,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any species set out in Part 2 of the schedule in the areas in which it is prohibited, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any species set out in Part 2 or 3 of the schedule in a particular region or body of water frequented by fish where the species is not indigenous and may harm fish, fish habitat or the use of fish; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to treat or destroy any member of a species described in paragraph (b).

Subsection.Text: A fishery officer or fishery guardian or a person acting under their direction may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: treat or destroy a member of an aquatic invasive species or a carrier or treat a conveyance or structure;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: establish a temporary barrier around the member of an aquatic invasive species or the carrier, conveyance or structure; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: post signs or markers that prohibit access around the member of an aquatic invasive species or the carrier, conveyance or structure.

Subsection.Text: A person must give all reasonable assistance requested by the fishery officer or the fishery guardian to enable them to carry out the measures set out in subsection (1) and must provide any information requested by them that is relevant to the measures if the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is in possession of a member of a species set out in Part 2 or 3 of the schedule;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is in possession or in charge of a carrier, conveyance or structure or owns or occupies the land, building or place where the member of the species is found; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is engaged in any activity that may lead or has led to the introduction or spread of the species.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), a fishery officer may give a written direction requiring a person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to restrict any activity that may lead to the introduction or spread of an aquatic invasive species;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to restrict access to a place where a member of the species is found;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to engage in any activity to prevent the introduction or spread of the species; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: to engage in any activity to treat or destroy the member of the species or a carrier or to treat a conveyance or structure.

Subsection.Text: The direction may be given only to a person who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is in possession of a member of the species or of a carrier, conveyance or structure where a member of the species is found;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is in charge of a carrier, conveyance or structure where a member of the species is found;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: owns or occupies the land, building or place where a member of the species is found; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: is engaged in any activity that may lead or has led to the introduction or spread of the species.

Subsection.Text: If a direction given under paragraph (1)(d) requires the use of fishing as a means to destroy members of a species set out in Part 2 or 3 of the schedule, the person to whom the direction is given is exempted from the requirement to hold a licence to fish for that species.

If a direction given under subsection (1) requires a person to be in possession of or to transport a member of a species set out in Part 2 of the schedule, that person is exempted from sections 7 and 8 to the extent necessary to fulfill the requirements of the direction.
The Minister may give a written direction requiring the deposit of a deleterious substance belonging to one of the classes of deleterious substances authorized under section 21

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to prevent the introduction or spread of, or to control or eradicate,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any species set out in Part 2 of the schedule in the areas in which it is prohibited, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any species set out in Part 2 or 3 of the schedule in a particular region or body of water frequented by fish where the species is not indigenous and may harm fish, fish habitat or the use of fish; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to treat or destroy any member of a species described in paragraph (a) or a carrier or to treat a conveyance or structure where a member of the species is found.

Subsection.Text: The direction may be given only to a person who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is in possession of a member of the species or of a carrier, conveyance or structure where a member of the species is found;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is in charge of a carrier, conveyance or structure where a member of the species is found;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: owns or occupies the land, building or place where a member of the species is found; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: is engaged in any activity that may lead or has led to the introduction or spread of the species.

Subsection.Text: If a direction given under subsection (1) requires a person to be in possession of or to transport a member of a species set out in Part 2 of the schedule, that person is exempted from sections 7 and 8 to the extent necessary to fulfill the requirements of the direction.
The measures set out in subsections 19(2) and (3) and 25(1) and the directions given in accordance with subsections 22(2), 26(1) and 27(1) must not be taken or given unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the measure or direction does not compromise public safety;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a measure or direction affecting a vessel, the measure or direction is taken or given only to the extent that it does not compromise the safety of the vessel or the persons on board and, in the case of vessels over 24 m in length, if the Minister, the fishery officer or the fishery guardian has consulted the Minister of Transport or a marine safety inspector before taking the measure or giving the direction; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a non-emergency situation in which the measure or direction may have a significant impact on activities under the jurisdiction of a department or agency of the Government of Canada or the government of any province or municipality, the Minister, the fishery officer or the fishery guardian has notified that department, agency or government.

Subsection.Text: If a measure or direction referred to in subsection (1) involves the deposit of a deleterious substance,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: alternative measures and the impact of the deposit on fish, fish habitat or the use of fish must be taken into account; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the deposit must be authorized by a person prescribed under section 18.

Subsection.Text: Directions given under subsection 26(1) or 27(1) must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: describe the member of the aquatic invasive species and the carrier, conveyance or structure, if there is one, that is the subject of the direction;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: briefly describe the reasons for the direction;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: set out the time period in respect of which the direction applies, up to a maximum of 15 days with an extension of up to a maximum of 90 days;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: describe the requirements set out in subsection 26(1) or 27(1); and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: be delivered in person or, if that is not possible, be posted in a conspicuous place at or near the location of the member of the species or of the carrier, conveyance or structure.

Subsection.Text: Directions given under subsection 27(1) must also

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: set out the place and manner in which the member of the species or the carrier, conveyance or structure, if there is one, must be treated or destroyed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: set out the date by which the requirement must be satisfied; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: state the terms and conditions applicable to the deposit of the deleterious substance.

Subsection.Text: Every person to whom a direction is given under subsection 22(2), 26(1) or 27(1)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: must follow the requirements specified in the direction; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is prohibited from engaging in any activity contrary to the requirements specified in the direction.

Subsection.Text: It is prohibited for any person to enter an area

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: around which the temporary barrier referred to in paragraph 25(1)(b) has been established; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: around which the signs or markers referred to in paragraph 25(1)(c) have been posted.

Section.Text: [Amendments]
[Amendment]
[Amendment]
[Amendment]
[Amendment]
[Amendment]

[Amendment]
[Amendment]
[Amendment]
[Amendment]
These Regulations come into force on the day on which they are registered.

ScheduleFormHeading.Label: SCHEDULE
ScheduleFormHeading.OriginatingRef: (Sections 1, 2, 4 and 6 to 9, subsection 13(1), section 14, paragraph 19(2)(a), section 23, paragraphs 24(b) and 25(2)(a), subsections 26(3) and (4) and paragraph 27(1)(a) and subsection 27(3))

Provision.Text: The following definitions apply in this schedule.

Definition.Text: boundary waters has the same meaning as in the Preliminary Article of the Treaty relating to Boundary Waters and Questions arising along the Boundary between Canada and the United States as set out in Schedule 1 to the International Boundary Waters Treaty Act. (eaux limitrophes)
transboundary waters means those waters that, in their natural channels, flow across the international boundary between Canada and the United States. (eaux transfrontalières)

Provision.Text: The geographic coordinates in this schedule are in reference to the North American Datum 1983 (NAD83).

table.title: Species Subject to Prohibitions and Controls

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: the transboundary waters in Ontario, downstream of the bridge crossing the Pigeon River located at 48°00′05.1″N 89°35′06.8″W;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: the boundary waters of the Canadian Great Lakes and connecting waterways, between the location of the bridge and the boundary between Ontario and Quebec; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: the boundary and transboundary waters in Quebec

row.entry: British Columbia, Alberta, Saskatchewan and Manitoba
British Columbia, Alberta, Saskatchewan and Manitoba
British Columbia, Alberta, Saskatchewan and Manitoba

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: the transboundary waters in Ontario, downstream of the bridge crossing the Pigeon River located at 48°00′05.1″N 89°35′06.8″W;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: the boundary waters of the Canadian Great Lakes and connecting waterways, between the location of the bridge and the boundary between Ontario and Quebec; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: the boundary and transboundary waters in Quebec

row.entry: British Columbia, Alberta, Saskatchewan and Manitoba
British Columbia, Alberta, Saskatchewan and Manitoba
British Columbia, Alberta, Saskatchewan and Manitoba
Any species of the snakehead family
Any species of the family Channidae
All species of the genera Rhodeus and Tanakia

table.title: Species Subject to Controls Only in Areas Where They Are Not Indigenous
